content.raw:
Fixed the Ok button problem on d0becfd

The `unit_cylinder` issue problem is related to the inspector remembering non-saved values even when if you Cancel. This is also observed on default, I ticketed a separate issue for that: #1472.
content.html:
Fixed the Ok button problem on d0becfd

The unit_cylinder issue problem is related to the inspector remembering non-saved values even when if you Cancel. This is also observed on default, I ticketed a separate issue for that: #1472.

content.raw:
Looks good, just two UI details that are somewhat subjective:

The default mesh URI for a simple shape is often the name of the link (unit_cylinder, etc.). It seem strange that the default URI is invalid.

When I enter an invalid mesh URI and hit "OK", I get a pop-up, which is good, but then the Link Inspector exits. It might be nice not to exit, in case the user made a mistake entering the URI and wants to redo it.
content.html:
Looks good, just two UI details that are somewhat subjective:

The default mesh URI for a simple shape is often the name of the link (unit_cylinder, etc.). It seem strange that the default URI is invalid.

When I enter an invalid mesh URI and hit "OK", I get a pop-up, which is good, but then the Link Inspector exits. It might be nice not to exit, in case the user made a mistake entering the URI and wants to redo it.

content.raw: Yeah ok I'll just do that. When the user presses `Apply` or `Ok`, check for the extension of the mesh geometry and if it isn't a valid file, a popup comes up alerting that *none* of the changes in the whole dialog will be applied unless a proper file or another geometry is chosen.
content.html: Yeah ok I'll just do that. When the user presses Apply or Ok, check for the extension of the mesh geometry and if it isn't a valid file, a popup comes up alerting that none of the changes in the whole dialog will be applied unless a proper file or another geometry is chosen.

The crashing also happens for the `ImportDialog`, looking into it now.

I see what you mean, @iche033 do you think it's a good idea to check all fields in the inspector before sending them and in case something is invalid, open a dialog alerting the user instead of printing errors?

The crashing also happens for the ImportDialog, looking into it now.

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Added button to select mesh file on inspector

content.raw:
The general flow and code looks good. When I type a filename that does not exist in the mesh field in the Link Inspector (instead of selecting through the dialog), the shape defaults to the default link, a unit box. I would expect the "Invalid mesh URI" dialog to appear. Also, this gets printed in the terminal with `--verbose`, but Gazebo doesn't crash.

```
[Err] [Visual.cc:2329] No mesh found, setting mesh to a unit box
```

When I put a directory or a file that is not a .dae or .stl in the mesh field, Gazebo crashes:

```
[Err] [MeshManager.cc:92] Invalid mesh filename extension[/home/jackie/model_editor_models]
[Err] [Visual.cc:1993] Unable to create a mesh from /home/jackie/model_editor_models
```
content.html:
The general flow and code looks good. When I type a filename that does not exist in the mesh field in the Link Inspector (instead of selecting through the dialog), the shape defaults to the default link, a unit box. I would expect the "Invalid mesh URI" dialog to appear. Also, this gets printed in the terminal with --verbose, but Gazebo doesn't crash.

[Err] [Visual.cc:2329] No mesh found, setting mesh to a unit box

When I put a directory or a file that is not a .dae or .stl in the mesh field, Gazebo crashes:

[Err] [MeshManager.cc:92] Invalid mesh filename extension[/home/jackie/model_editor_models]
[Err] [Visual.cc:1993] Unable to create a mesh from /home/jackie/model_editor_models
